intro: Pyramidanthe clementis, commonly known as the Clement's pyramidanthe, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly found in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its dense, spiky foliage and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and requires partial to full sunlight. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
